sentences: Meie koerad leiavad alati aega magamiseks.
context: The word 'leiavad' is the 3rd person plural present tense form of the Estonian verb 'leidma', which means 'to find'. It is used when referring to multiple people or things that are currently finding or discovering something. The root form 'leidma' can be conjugated in different tenses and numbers: singular present - 'leiab', plural present - 'leiavad', past tense - 'leidsid', etc.
